paragraphs.content: The General Epistle of James
paragraphs.contentHtml: <small>The General Epistle of</small> James

paragraphs.content: Chapter 1
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 1

paragraphs.content: James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes which are scattered abroad, greeting.
paragraphs.contentHtml: James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes which are scattered abroad, greeting.

paragraphs.content: My brethren, count it all joy when ye fall into divers temptations;
paragraphs.contentHtml: My brethren, count it all joy when ye fall into divers temptations;

paragraphs.content: Knowing this, that the trying of your faith worketh patience.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Knowing this, that the trying of your faith worketh patience.

paragraphs.content: But let patience have her perfect work, that ye may be perfect and entire, wanting nothing.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But let patience have her perfect work, that ye may be perfect and entire, wanting nothing.

paragraphs.content: If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, that giveth to all men liberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, that giveth to all men liberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.

paragraphs.content: But let him ask in faith, nothing wavering. For he that wavereth is like a wave of the sea driven with the wind and tossed.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But let him ask in faith, nothing wavering. For he that wavereth is like a wave of the sea driven with the wind and tossed.

paragraphs.content: For let not that man think that he shall receive any thing of the Lord.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For let not that man think that he shall receive any thing of the Lord.

paragraphs.content: A double minded man is unstable in all his ways.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A double minded man is unstable in all his ways.

paragraphs.content: Let the brother of low degree rejoice in that he is exalted:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let the brother of low degree rejoice in that he is exalted:

paragraphs.content: But the rich, in that he is made low: because as the flower of the grass he shall pass away.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But the rich, in that he is made low: because as the flower of the grass he shall pass away.

paragraphs.content: For the sun is no sooner risen with a burning heat, but it withereth the grass, and the flower thereof falleth, and the grace of the fashion of it perisheth: so also shall the rich man fade away in his ways.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the sun is no sooner risen with a burning heat, but it withereth the grass, and the flower thereof falleth, and the grace of the fashion of it perisheth: so also shall the rich man fade away in his ways.

paragraphs.content: Blessed is the man that endureth temptation: for when he is tried, he shall receive the crown of life, which the Lord hath promised to them that love him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Blessed is the man that endureth temptation: for when he is tried, he shall receive the crown of life, which the Lord hath promised to them that love him.

paragraphs.content: Let no man say when he is tempted, I am tempted of God: for God cannot be tempted with evil, neither tempteth he any man:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let no man say when he is tempted, I am tempted of God: for God cannot be tempted with evil, neither tempteth he any man:

paragraphs.content: But every man is tempted, when he is drawn away of his own lust, and enticed.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But every man is tempted, when he is drawn away of his own lust, and enticed.

paragraphs.content: Then when lust hath conceived, it bringeth forth sin: and sin, when it is finished, bringeth forth death.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then when lust hath conceived, it bringeth forth sin: and sin, when it is finished, bringeth forth death.

paragraphs.content: Do not err, my beloved brethren.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Do not err, my beloved brethren.

paragraphs.content: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, and cometh down from the Father of lights, with whom is no variableness, neither shadow of turning.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, and cometh down from the Father of lights, with whom is no variableness, neither shadow of turning.

paragraphs.content: Of his own will begat he us with the word of truth, that we should be a kind of firstfruits of his creatures.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Of his own will begat he us with the word of truth, that we should be a kind of firstfruits of his creatures.

paragraphs.content: Wherefore, my beloved brethren, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wherefore, my beloved brethren, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath:

paragraphs.content: For the wrath of man worketh not the righteousness of God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the wrath of man worketh not the righteousness of God.

paragraphs.content: Wherefore lay apart all filthiness and superfluity of naughtiness, and receive with meekness the engrafted word, which is able to save your souls.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wherefore lay apart all filthiness and superfluity of naughtiness, and receive with meekness the engrafted word, which is able to save your souls.

paragraphs.content: But be ye doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving your own selves.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But be ye doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving your own selves.

paragraphs.content: For if any be a hearer of the word, and not a doer, he is like unto a man beholding his natural face in a glass:
paragraphs.contentHtml: For if any be a hearer of the word, and not a doer, he is like unto a man beholding his natural face in a glass:

paragraphs.content: For he beholdeth himself, and goeth his way, and straightway forgetteth what manner of man he was.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For he beholdeth himself, and goeth his way, and straightway forgetteth what manner of man he was.

paragraphs.content: But whoso looketh into the perfect law of liberty, and continueth therein, he being not a forgetful hearer, but a doer of the work, this man shall be blessed in his deed.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But whoso looketh into the perfect law of liberty, and continueth therein, he being not a forgetful hearer, but a doer of the work, this man shall be blessed in his deed.

paragraphs.content: If any man among you seem to be religious, and bridleth not his tongue, but deceiveth his own heart, this man’s religion is vain.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If any man among you seem to be religious, and bridleth not his tongue, but deceiveth his own heart, this man’s religion is vain.

paragraphs.content: Pure religion and undefiled before God and the Father is this, To visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, and to keep himself unspotted from the world.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Pure religion and undefiled before God and the Father is this, To visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, and to keep himself unspotted from the world.
